text.p: Swiss shares ended lower in slow, low volume trading and dealers said the session was marked by a general lack of investor interest.
Investors seemed to be worried by the current high price levels and were waiting for shares to slip lower before coming into the market, the dealers said.
Disappointing Novartis nine-month sales also dampened sentiment.
The SMI index of leading shares down 12.9 points at 3,775.3 and the all-share SPI closed 7.04 points lower at 2,422.61.
Dealers said nine-month sales for Ciba, which will merge with Sandoz to form Novartis, were below expectations. Sandoz sales were judged to be more positive by the market.
Ciba's sales rose two percent, while Sandoz sales were eight percent higher.
Ciba registered shares eased 12 francs to 1,576. Sandoz slipped 11 to 1,484.
Roche certificates rose 10 francs to 9,650 and dealers reported shifting out of Novartis into Roche.

ABB, which reported a 24 percent nine-month profit rise, lost nine francs to end at 1,569. Dealers said the stock saw profit-taking despite the fact that results were at the high end of the range of expectations.
Profit-taking was also reported in Nestle, which closed seven francs lower at 1,397.
